result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Eduardo Serna was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Court does not object to transfer to Milwaukee or Sheboygan County.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Brookfield Police Department.
AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.    No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.   No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel in Waukesha County.  Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.  Comply with all drivers licensing restrictions.  

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Commencing forthwith.  First 45 days as Straight time in the Waukesha County Jail.  Following 45 days may be served with Huber, standard release conditions, or electronic monitoring if the Sheriff deems it appropriate.  Court grants 2 days credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Information filed.    Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

State places offer on the record. 
Court conducts plea colloquy. 

Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.
Count 2 is Dismissed and read in.
Count 3 is Dismissed by operation of law.

Bond is revoked. 
The trial is removed from the calendar.  
Defendant may be returned to the appropriate facility forthwith.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Check Case scheduled for June 20, 2022.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Hearing on March 2, 2020 at 09:30 am.

10:41 AM Defendant Eduardo Serna in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Serna to report to WCS to either make an intake appointment meet with a case manager.  After WCS, Mr. Serna to report to the public defender's office to apply for representation.  Mr. Serna is then to report back to court immediately following those two places.  If courtroom closed, he is to return at 1:30 p.m.

MR. SERNA Reported back to court at 11:50 a.m.:  The courtroom was closed, Per Judge Dorow, the clerk verified off the record that Mr. Serna has an appointment with WCS on Thursday, February 6, and does qualify for a public defender. 
Mr Serna verfied his address and phone number.  Court notice for March 2, 2020 was provided to Mr. Serna.

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 01/29/2020 received and filed.

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 01/29/2020--The defendant must appear in court on Friday 01/31/2020 to explain why he failure to report to WCS. Hearing may be held before Branch 2 or a Court Commissioner.**
